titles.title: Acknowledging the National Academy of Inventors (NAI) as a driving factor in the world economy and the contributions of scientist-inventors across all disciplines.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E215-216)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet.

committee.name: House Judiciary
committee.subcommittee: Intellectual Property, Competition and the Internet

bill.summary: 2/15/2012--Introduced. Acknowledges the National Academy of Inventors (NAI) as a driving factor in the world economy and the contributions of scientist-inventors. Expresses support for university technological developments, promoting entrepreneurship and, support for university innovations in local communities. Recognizes the importance of inventions, patents, and copyrights as part of maintaining U.S. leadership in the world and a competitive global economy.
